title: Hint
text:
1) Recall the definitions:
• A function f(s) is even if $$f(-s)$$ $$=$$ f(s).
• A function f(s) is odd if $$f(-s)$$ $$=$$ $$-f(s)$$.

2) Given f(s) $$=$$ s⁴ + 3s² + $$7$$, calculate $$f(-s)$$:
$$f(-s)$$ $$=$$ $$(-s)⁴$$ + $$3(-s)²$$ + $$7$$ $$=$$ s⁴ + 3s² + $$7$$.

3) Compare $$f(-s)$$ with f(s):
f(s) $$=$$ s⁴ + 3s² + $$7$$,
$$f(-s)$$ $$=$$ s⁴ + 3s² + $$7$$.

Since $$f(-s)$$ $$=$$ f(s), the function f(s) is even.
